name: Avoid using complex Allocates in Fortran 90 Function  (FORTRAN)
description:
The number of complex Allocate Statements are reported, which is defined as using a single Allocate statement to allocate multiple variables to memory. Example of such a complex allocate statement: 

allocate(test_cast(n),test_cast2(n),stat=cast_stat)
rationale: Using such a statement reduces the readability and understandability. It becomes difficult to track what variables have been allocated and deallocated.
remediation: Use a single allocate for a single variable.
alternativeName: Avoid using complex Allocates in Fortran 90 Function  (FORTRAN)
